content: Ok, this is a great reflection Claude. I want to dig a little deeper into the code boxes though. We were having MAJOR issues with the large module code files. They only got fixed when you were doing it in the main window. My observation (with some assumptions baked in that you'll have to analyze) is that doing it in a code block in the main chat forced you to pick up where you left off and continue without being able to go back and revise code. It was almost as if KNOWING that you couldn't go back forced you to do it right the first time and go to top to bottom. From my perspective, for these large files, generating in this manner and having me copy/paste them into the main file, proved to be much more effective. I completely understand why you made the recommendation you did, but that is also how you, and every other AI, is programmed to think. Again, looking for HONESTY and SELF REFLECTION here, not for you to agree with me. You are CTO, not structured to just agree with me, but to think independently in alignment with the Charter. What do you think?
